posts.post_content: Note: Vinifera, preventing combat damage isn't something that is specifically against mages. That sounds more like a divine protection a deity would bless a patron with. Mages use spells, so I would think that if something is a bane to mages, it'd have shroud and *allow* you to fly so you you can actually be on par with those pesky, evasive mages.

Posted By: MagicStick (7/18/2009 8:37:55 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: There's so little I like about this card. It's +2/+4, which is obviously a solid increase, but losing flying is a healthy drawback that limits it's deployment. Secondly, if it's magebane, why is it preventing damage? Magebane implies that it should \*\*\*ist in killing mages, but it doesn't prevent kills, removal, or negative enchantments. This should have been enemy-shroud ("Cannot be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control") rather than damage prevention, to fit the name. My biggest complaint, however, is that it's rare. There's no way that this is a rare powerlevel card, in my opinion-- especially when commons and uncommons are the backbone of this set, as there's many commons or uncommons that I would unequivocally prefer to pull out of a pack over this. The only thing that puts it remotely in rare territory is the P/T boost, which makes it feel like a trumped-up uncommon rather than a unique rare. Seriously-- search for rare equipment in Standard and decide for yours... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

This should have been enemy-shroud ("Cannot be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control") rather than damage prevention, to fit the name. My biggest complaint, however, is that it's rare. There's no way that this is a rare powerlevel card, in my opinion-- especially when commons and uncommons are the backbone of this set, as there's many commons or uncommons that I would unequivocally prefer to pull out of a pack over this. The only thing that puts it remotely in rare territory is the P/T boost, which makes it feel like a trumped-up uncommon rather than a unique rare. Seriously-- search for rare equipment in Standard and decide for yours... (see all)

Posted By: MightyMortox (7/25/2009 9:37:07 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Correct me if I'm wrong, but wouldn't [Protean Hydra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Protean Hydra) be unkillable through damage with this on? Seeing as he prevents damage but removes +1/+1 counters, he could never remove the +2/+4 given by this card.  
  
Even without that combo, this card is great for any deck that runs low or no fliers. Personally, I protect my [Elvish Piper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish Piper)s with this beast. Not the greatest Equipment, but certainly decent in some situations. My opponents are spell fanatics, red everywhere and my green weenies need protection from those [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt)s whenever possible.
posts.html:
Correct me if I'm wrong, but wouldn't Protean Hydra be unkillable through damage with this on? Seeing as he prevents damage but removes +1/+1 counters, he could never remove the +2/+4 given by this card.

Even without that combo, this card is great for any deck that runs low or no fliers. Personally, I protect my Elvish Pipers with this beast. Not the greatest Equipment, but certainly decent in some situations. My opponents are spell fanatics, red everywhere and my green weenies need protection from those Lightning Bolts whenever possible.

Posted By: JacksJokeShop (7/31/2009 7:58:32 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@ JacksJokeShop--Yes, you could make Protean Hydra nigh-invincible with this--or, for that matter, anything that give him at least +0/+1. As long as he has one Toughness that isn't caused by his counters, he can't be killed by damage. In fact, you could use him as a chump blocker to double his P/T as long as you had him equipped with something that boosted his toughness (or any bonus that didn't manifest as counters, such as something that gave all Green creatures +1/+1 or something.
  
   
Anyways, regarding the actual card here, Magebane is really useful for powering up a sturdy defender and protecting it from removal, especially if they aren't vulnerable to cards like Doomblade and Terminate (maybe they've got protection from black or something). Especially effective when combined with Shield of the Righteous.

posts.post_content: There's so little I like about this card. It's +2/+4, which is obviously a solid increase, but losing flying is a healthy drawback that limits it's deployment. Secondly, if it's magebane, why is it preventing damage? Magebane implies that it should \*\*\*ist in killing mages, but it doesn't prevent kills, removal, or negative enchantments. This should have been enemy-shroud ("Cannot be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control") rather than damage prevention, to fit the name. My biggest complaint, however, is that it's rare. There's no way that this is a rare powerlevel card, in my opinion-- especially when commons and uncommons are the backbone of this set, as there's many commons or uncommons that I would unequivocally prefer to pull out of a pack over this. The only thing that puts it remotely in rare territory is the P/T boost, which makes it feel like a trumped-up uncommon rather than a unique rare. Seriously-- search for rare equipment in Standard and decide for yours... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
